channel.title: codal-microbit-v2 on micro:bit v2 Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in codal-microbit-v2 on micro:bit v2 Documentation

item.title: MicroBit
item.description: Represents the micro:bit v2 in its entirety. Allows for convenient access to device drivers to control the micro:bit’s various hardware elements.

item.title: MicroBitAudio
item.description: The audio API for micro:bit v2. Allows for multi-stream audio playback with a basic mixer, in addition to synthesiser support for small sound bytes.

item.title: MicroBitBLEManager
item.description: Bluetooth low energy stack manager for the micro:bit’s BLE. Must be enabled at compile to be included in CODAL builds.

item.title: MicroBitCompassCalibrator
item.description: A compass calibration class for CODAL’s compass abstraction on the micro:bit.

item.title: MicroBitDisplay
item.description: An abstraction layer over the micro:bit’s ‘display’ (LED matrix), allowing for string display and animated images.

item.title: MicroBitI2C
item.description: I2C protocol wrapper for the micro:bit. Allows for creating I2C channels over provided NRF52 pins.

item.title: MicroBitIO
item.description: Container for representations of all the micro:bit’s pins as NRF52 pin instances.

item.title: MicroBitLog
item.description: A simple logging API for the micro:bit, which enables generated results to be viewed easily from an external PC.

item.title: MicroBitPowerManager
item.description: Power management interface for the micro:bit. Holds information on power usage, as well as functions for working with deep sleep modes.

item.title: MicroBitRadio
item.description: A radio abstraction for the micro:bit. Contains functions for sending and receiving data over a set of radio bands, with buffering support.

item.title: MicroBitThermometer
item.description: A pseudo-thermometer for the micro:bit v2. Infers the ambient temperature based on the surface temperature readings of various chips on the micro:bit.

item.title: MicroBitUSBFlashManager
item.description: An abstraction for managing the micro:bit’s USB interface and corresponding flash.
